An alert contains both primary and secon: Las alertas contienen texto primario y secundario.
The primary text contains a brief summar: El texto primario contiene un resumen breve de la situación y sugieren una acción. Este texto debe mostrarse en negritas y un poco más grande que el resto del texto.
The secondary text provides a more detai: El texto secundario explica a detalle la situación y describe cualquier efecto secundario que pueda resultar como consecuencia de las acciones disponibles. Cabe mencionar que los usuarios solo deberían necesitar el texto primario para hacer una decisión; el texto secundario solo aclara las cosas. Este texto se ubica debajo del primario, separado de este por un salto de línea, y mostrado en el tamaño y peso de letra predeterminado.
Make both the primary and secondary text: Haga que los textos primario y secundario puedan seleccionarse. Esto permitirá a los usuarios copipegarlo para, por ejemplo, enviarlo en un mensaje de correo electrónico.
All dialogs should contain an affirmativ: All dialogs should contain an affirmative button that performs the action suggested in the primary text. This button goes on the far right side of the window.
For dialogs that are displayed in respon: For dialogs that are displayed in response to user action (such as "Quit"), provide a "Cancel" button directly to the left of the affirmative button.
If your dialog has alternative actions,: If your dialog has alternative actions, list them to the left of the "Cancel" button.
If you wish your dialog to contain a &qu: If you wish your dialog to contain a "Help" button, this should be placed to the far left of the window.
When presenting a dialog to a user, alwa: When presenting a dialog to a user, always use explicit action names like "Save...", "Shut Down", etc. Consider that using "OK" enables users to proceed without understand the action they are authorizing. Not all users will read the question or information presented to them in a dialog. Using specific action names will make it harder for a user to select an unintended action and may even encourage them to read the information presented before making a selection.
Preference dialogs should be made Transi: Preference dialogs should be made Transient, but not Modal. When a user makes a change in a preference dialog, the change should be immediately visible in the UI. If the dialog is modal, the user may be blocked from seeing (and especially from interacting with) the change. This means they will have to close the dialog, evaluate the change, then possibly re-open the dialog. By making the dialog transient, we keep the dialog on top for easy access, but we also allow the user to evaluate and possibly revert the change without having to close and re-open the preference dialog.
